Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the statue was not made from the rubble collected in war-torn Aleppo, as it was a digital artwork created by the Syrian artist Tammam Azzam in 2012.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the artwork by presenting it as a real physical statue made from rubble, when it was actually a digital artwork.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the statue was made from rubble collected in war-torn Aleppo, as the expert's verdict clearly states that it was a digital artwork created by the artist.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the statue depicted in the photograph is a real physical statue made from rubble, without verifying the authenticity or origin of the image.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the statue is a digital artwork created by the Syrian artist Tammam Azzam, using a photograph of a destroyed Syrian building.
